column2: Accordingly,  an  admission can  be  made in the following ways:

(i) 
Where the parties or their agents agree to admit a fact at the hearing;

(ii) 
Where  before the  hearing,  parties  agree  to admit a fact  by  any  writing  under their

(iii) 
Where,  by any  rule  of pleading  in  force  at the time the parties are  deemed to have
admitted a fact by their pleadings.
